Bringing HDR video to Reels
node.Description:
Meta has made it possible for people to upload high dynamic range (HDR) videos from their phone’s camera roll to Reels on Facebook and Instagram. To show standard dynamic range (SDR) UI elements and overlays legibly on top of HDR video, we render them at a brightness level comparable to the video itself. We solved [...]

node.Title: From Hive Tables to Iceberg Tables: Hassle-Free
node.Description:
Introduction For more than a decade now, the Hive table format has been a ubiquitous presence in the big data ecosystem, managing petabytes of data with remarkable efficiency and scale. But as the data volumes, data variety, and data usage grows, users face many challenges when using Hive tables because of its antiquated directory-based table […]

node.Title: How terrifying is giving a conference talk? (Ep. 589)
node.Description:
Connell, a UK-based .NET developer and senior software engineer at Stack Overflow, tells the home team about his path to software development via text-based RPGs, his work on Stack Overflow’s Community Enablement team, why Agile gets so much hate, and what he’s learned giving conference talks to developers.

node.Title: I use GitHub Ac­tions for Data­dog's Service Catalog, and you should, too
node.Description: Today’s guest blog is by Mike Stem­le, a software engineer and Principal Architect for the Ar­c XP di­vi­sion of the Wash­ing­ton Post. In his role, Mike focuses on AppSec and large-scale architecture.Any­body who works with me knows that I love the Data­dog Service Catalog. Ser­vice Cat­a­log is great for our teams because it puts ser­vice own­er­ship and pro­duc­tion support in­for­ma­tion right next to the met­rics we use to de­tect­ out­ages and per­for­mance is­sues.

node.Title: The hidden data challenges CIOs face on their quest to accelerate business outcomes
Gaming Solution Brief
node.Description: Gaming studios face high stakes when it comes to delivering great experiences for their players.In this solution brief, you’ll learn how Datadog provides real-time application performance and analytics data and enables gaming studios to:Deliver responsive, always-on gameplay Ensure site reliability during game launches Analyze in-game KPIs and business metrics Unlock granular, player-centric performance insights at any scale

node.Title: Hybrid Cloud Monitoring Solution Brief
node.Description: Adopting a multi-cloud or hybrid-cloud architecture enables organizations to improve resilience and maintain control over their data, but can also introduce complexity and blind spots for teams.In this solution brief, you’ll learn how Datadog provides hybrid cloud monitoring and enables teams to:Track the performance of cloud platforms side-by-side Collaborate without friction and troubleshoot issues faster Get instant visibility into hosted services from cloud providers Filter, aggregate, and correlate data from any environment

node.Title: Machine Learning and AIOps Solution Brief
node.Description: Machine learning enables engineering teams to more rapidly scale up their systems, but can also introduce complexity and require increased headcount.In this solution brief, you’ll learn how Datadog provides built-in machine learning and enables organizations to:Reduce time spent on detecting, investigating, and resolving issues Automatically surface unusual behavior within applications and services Contextualize insights for monitoring large, dynamic fleets Build automated AIOps workflows

node.Title: OpenShift Solution Brief
node.Description: Red Hat OpenShift helps organizations to build a stable, secure platform on top of Kubernetes. Despite its benefits, monitoring OpenShift can be complex.In this solution brief, you’ll learn how Datadog simplifies OpenShift monitoring and enables you to:Run an efficient OpenShift environment Reduce troubleshooting time and confidently resolve performance issues Proactively monitor complex infrastructures Alert on unusual changes in key OpenShift performance metrics

node.Title: 12 Times Faster Query Planning With Iceberg Manifest Caching in Impala
node.Description:
Iceberg is an emerging open-table format designed for large analytic workloads. The Apache Iceberg project continues developing an implementation of Iceberg specification in the form of Java Library. Several compute engines such as Impala, Hive, Spark, and Trino have supported querying data in Iceberg table format by adopting this Java Library provided by the Apache […]

The post 12 Times Faster Query Planning With Iceberg Manifest Caching in Impala appeared first on Cloudera Blog.
